posts.name: ToddF
posts.cooked:
For all you folks who aren’t subscribed to our YouTube channel, here are a couple videos of what Triple Helix has been up to with our prototyping this year.

We started with this crude intake prototype.

This was refined to work on the path of the cargo to the shooter.

link_counts.title: FRC 2363 Triple Helix 2022 Intake Testing and Shooter prototyping - YouTube

posts.name: Nick.kremer
posts.cooked: You might consider having a bottom kicker bar to assist in getting the balls off the ground. An easy way to test if a kicker bar helps is taping a piece of churro or hex to the bumper. In our testing this really did help!

posts.name: Ethan Braun
posts.cooked: Can you upload a video of that intake actuating? I want to see that linkage in action.

posts.name: ToddF
posts.cooked:
satel:

Can you upload a video of that intake actuating?

Will do.  Keep an eye on our YouTube channel.

posts.name: ToddF
posts.cooked: Arm testing video is up.

posts.name: Eli Barnett
posts.cooked: Nice linkage.

user_custom_fields.user_field_4: Robot apartments! invisible suburbs! skeleton treasuries!

posts.custom_user_title: Robot apartments! invisible suburbs! skeleton treasuries!

posts.name: Sanjai Bashyam
posts.cooked: How do you go about designing a linkage like this in Solidworks? I tried just starting from scratch in Solidworks and think I could recreate it but it would be a slow guess and check process. Is there a proper way? Maybe if I can define the 2 end points - where I want the rollers relative to the chassis and where I want them when folded in?

user_custom_fields.user_field_4: Moving to Seattle - Looking for Computer Vision Job - Former 1640 Mentor and Drive Coach

posts.custom_user_title: Moving to Seattle - Looking for Computer Vision Job - Former 1640 Mentor and Drive Coach

posts.name: ahartnet
posts.cooked:
@cadandcookies has a great video about linkages: Linkages: Basic Linkages In Onshape - YouTube

The triple helix one is a bit more complicated in that there’s another rotational point in that top linkage.

link_counts.title: Linkages: Basic Linkages In Onshape - YouTube

posts.name: OccamzRazor
posts.cooked: That linkage is something we have been looking for as a solution to how tight our robot is this year.  We have a similar linkage but your solution is so much more elegant and compact!

posts.name: Nate Laverdure (he/him)
posts.cooked:
ferrari77:

How do you go about designing a linkage like this in Solidworks?

I have an idea for a way to describe the process we used.  Will noodle around and publish it when I can.

posts.name: paulonis
posts.cooked: Very interesting that the flexible “fingers” are able to intake the ball.  Are those fingers just polycarb strips that are screwed onto a hex bar axle?

posts.name: Nate Laverdure (he/him)
posts.cooked: The flaps are constructed from vinyl strip door material-- i.e. the kind of door you’d find at the back of a supermarket.

posts.name: Ari Meles-Braverman
posts.cooked: Interesting. We tried using some of that same material on a roller over the intake to knock down bouncing balls to make intaking easier. We were not impressed by the results. We didn’t try using it for the intake itself though.

user_custom_fields.user_field_4: FIRST Israel CSA, FRC 5987/5951 Technical Mentor

posts.custom_user_title: FIRST Israel CSA, FRC 5987/5951 Technical Mentor

posts.name: Tom
posts.cooked: Just when our team was wondering how we were going to package a swing-down intake with two rollers… Thank you for sharing!

posts.name: Fields
posts.cooked: What are people finding to be a good intake speed? Most of the videos I’ve seen so far looks to have been 80-100% motor speed.

posts.name: ahartnet
posts.cooked: A rule of thumb that I’ve seen is having the surface speed of your intake roller be about 2x your robot speed. The thought being that even at the robot moving full speed forward, the roller is still bringing the game piece in.

posts.name: Nate Laverdure (he/him)
posts.cooked:
We posted a slide deck which details the process we followed to design this 4-bar intake deployment mechanism:

Thanks for the valuable and rapid feedback @ahartnet @ndp @ferrari77 @ToddF
